item.title: President Trump commutes the prison sentence of George Santos
item.description: The disgraced New York Republican was sentenced to more than seven years in prison after pleading guilty to a litany of federal charges, including wire fraud and identity theft.

item.title: Trump administration asks Supreme Court to allow National Guard deployment in Illinois
item.description: The Trump administration filed an appeal to the Supreme Court on Friday, asking it to lift lower-court rulings blocking Trump from deploying National Guard troops in Illinois.

item.title: What we know about the devastating storm in Western Alaska
item.description: The remnant of Typhoon Halong slammed the Yukon-Kuskokwim Delta, an area in Western Alaska hundreds of miles from the U.S. road system. More than a thousand people are displaced.

item.title: As tensions rise in Chicago, volunteers patrol neighborhoods to oppose ICE and help migrants escape

item.title: 40 years ago, a woman made Harlem Globetrotters history
item.description: Forty years ago this month, the comedic basketball troupe, the Harlem Globetrotters, added a woman to its roster. NPR's Ashley Montgomery has the story of legendary athlete Lynette Woodard.
